How Alex Pereira has quickly become an all-time great and fan-favourite in the UFC

  • A Captivating Rivalry
  • Human Highlight
  • Elite Activity
  • Greatness

A Captivating Rivalry

Before his UFC reign, Pereira had a stellar run in kickboxing.

Kickboxing Career Timeline

Periera defeated Israel Adesanya twice, once by knockout, during their kickboxing careers.

Izzy transitioned into MMA, making his UFC debut on February 11, 2018. He would find immense success and popularity in the UFC.

Israel Adesanya UFC fights and Instagram Followers

Izzy rose to meteoric popularity as he continued to dominate in the UFC.

Adesanya had words for Pereira in a 2018 interview with Sporting News Australia.

“No one knows who the f*ck he is" "When im a legend, he’s going to be at some pub talking some sh*t about I beat that guy one time"

Pereira did not take that too kindly...

“There is…an interview with Israel Adesanya that motivated me so much.” “I felt challenged. And whenever there is a challenge, no one can hold me back”

Pereira focused in on MMA, where he dismantled his competition. He was fast-tracked to the UFC and a match against current UFC Middleweight Champion and past rival, Israel Adesanya.

UFC 281: Adesanya vs. Pereira

After already defeating him twice in another sport, Pereira found his way to Adesanya in the UFC and knocked him out.

However, Pereira's rivalry with Izzy is not the only thing that makes him popular.

Knockout Artist

Pereira has a greater percentage of knockouts as his wins than any other champion of a men's division in the UFC.

Despite being the same age as established veteran Jon Jones (37), Pereira has been able to maintain elite activity in the octagon.

Fastest Ever to Three Title Defences

Pereira broke Rounda Rousey's record when he achieved three titles defences in 175 days.

His kickboxing pedigree translated extremely well to MMA and the UFC.

Pereira is arguably the best striker in the history of the UFC. He has a higher striking accuracy than some of the most highly-regarded strikers ever.
